column1: '''Upon the Hearth the Fire is Red''' is a song made by [[Bilbo Baggins]]
column2: which he set to a tune "as old as the hills". On [[24 September]] {{TA|3018}}
column6: and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] sang this song while they were walking in the [[Woody End]] of [[the Shire]]:

column1: ==Lyrics==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Upon the hearth the fire is red
Beneath the roof there is a bed;
But not yet weary are our feet
Still round the corner we may meet
A sudden tree or standing stone
That none have seen but we alone.
Tree and flower and leaf and grass
Let them pass! Let them pass!
Hill and water under sky
Pass them by! Pass them by!
Still round the corner there may wait
A new road or a secret gate
And though we pass them by today
Tomorrow we may come this way
And take the hidden paths that run
Towards the Moon or to the Sun.
Apple
Let them go! Let them go!
Sand and stone and pool and dell
Fare you well! Fare you well!
Home is behind
And there are many paths to tread
Through shadows to the edge of night
Until the stars are all alight.
Then world behind and home ahead
Weâ€™ll wander back to home and bed.
Mist and twilight
Away shall fade! Away shall fade!
Fire and lamp
And then to bed! And then to bed!
</poem>

As the song ended a tired Pippin re-sang the last line but changed it to match his desire for rest: "And ''now'' to bed! And ''now'' to bed!" Frodo hushed him since he heard the sound of hoofs approaching.<ref>{{FR|I3}}</ref>

On [[22 September]] {{TA|3021}}<ref>{{App|Chief}}</ref> [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] heard a different version of this song softly sung by Frodo as they rode westward through [[the Shire]] just before they met [[Elrond]]
column3: [[Gildor]] and other [[Elves]] heading for the [[Grey Havens]]:

column1: <poem style="font-style:italic;margin-left:20px;">
Still round the corner there may wait
A new road or a secret gate;
And though I oft have passed them by
A day will come at last when I
Shall take the hidden paths that run
West of the Moon
</poem>
==Legacy==
Donald Swann wrote music for this song
column2: which can be found in the book ''[[The Road Goes Ever On (book)|The Road Goes Ever On]]'';<ref>{{RGEO|Hearth}}</ref> it is also found on the accompanying CD of the latest version.
